channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023080267
item.description:
Report X-2023080267

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the load side. It was placed into a damage tote complete with liner. Once brought to QA, it was discovered that one of the caps had come off of the container, allowing the contents to leak freely. DescribePack: Cap off completely DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with liner, orientation arrows being observed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The sequence of events are unknown because the ops manager responsible for the area the damage was found in did not make any member of our administrative staff aware of the damage. DescribePack: The shipment is leaking at or near the bottom of the drum. The location of holes/cracks are unknown. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a spill tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070876
item.description:
Report X-2023070876

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic bottles in unsealed plastic bag inside corrugated carton without filler or padding. No arrows or hazard markings on exterior. Loose caps on multiple bottles allowed leakage which damaged bottle labels, shipping labels, and carton. Damage detected only after package was forwarded under a new barcode (TRK# 998094548427227) by destination station). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023060850
item.description:
Report X-2023060850

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: LITTLETON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Due to the cold nature of packages picked up from their local Safeway, a courier offered two packages to their station Dangerous Goods Specialist located in Littleton, Co , with the concern they may contain undeclared dry ice. Outer package was reported as a reflective padded pack and the inner packaging were plastic bags which contained frozen beef filets and undeclared Dry Ice. There were no marks nor labels on the packages to indicate there was dry ice in either package. Information was gathered on the packages and due to the perishable nature of the contents, the packages were held at the station and the shipper was called to retrieve the packages from the station.

item.title: Report E-2023070533
item.description:
Report E-2023070533

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, sixteen (16) one-gallon paint pails were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged pails and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2023070435
item.description:
Report E-2023070435

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that there was a leak in one case of vapocide (un3017) and that one of the inner poly 2.5 gallon jug had a defective lid and that 4 ounces had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070402
item.description:
Report E-2023070402

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 cases of hair clog remover (un1824) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 5 of the inner poly 1 liter bottles had released 5 liters of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
